questions.questionText: What is the primary function of the mitochondria in a cell?

options.text: To produce energy through cellular respiration
To transport proteins throughout the cell

questions.hint: Think about what process provides energy for cellular activities
questions.explanation: Mitochondria are known as the powerhouse of the cell because they produce energy through cellular respiration, converting glucose and oxygen into ATP (adenosine triphosphate).

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of living organisms?
questions.hint: Consider which option is not a fundamental characteristic of life
questions.explanation: While living organisms can conduct electricity to some degree, this is not a defining characteristic of life. The other options (growth, response to stimuli, reproduction) are fundamental characteristics of living organisms.
